answers.text: Minority Leaders are typically experienced lawmakers when they win election to this position

qas.question: In what congress did Nancy Pelosi bdcome minority leader?

qas.question: How long had Pelosi served as majority leader?
What position did Robert Michel have in the 104th Congress?
In what year did Richard Gephardt become GOP leader?

context: Like the Speaker of the House, the <a0_0>Minority Leaders are typically experienced lawmakers when they win election to this position<a0_0/>. When Nancy Pelosi, D-CA, became Minority Leader in the <a1_0>108th Congress<a1_0/>, she had served in the House nearly 20 years and had served as minority whip in the 107th Congress. When her predecessor, Richard Gephardt, D-MO, became <b8_0>minority leader<b8_0/> in the 104th House, he had been in the House for almost <a2_0>20 years<a2_0/>, had served as chairman of the Democratic Caucus for <b5_0>four years<b5_0/>, had been a 1988 <b6_0>president<b6_0/>ial candidate, and had been majority leader <b7_0>from June 1989 until Republicans captured control of the House in the November 1994 elections<b7_0/>. Gephardt's predecessor in the minority leadership position was Robert Michel, R-IL, who became GOP Leader in <a3_0><b9_0>1981<b9_0/><a3_0/> after spending 24 years in the House. Michel's predecessor, Republican John Rhodes of Arizona, was elected Minority Leader in <a4_0>1973<a4_0/> after 20 years of House service.
